 THE PAKISTAN COUNCIL FOR SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY 
ACT, 20 17 
 
ACT No. XIV or 2017  
[26th April, 2017 ] 
An Act to provide for establishment of th e Pakistan Council for Science and Technology  
 
WHEREAS  it is expedient  to provide  for the establishment  of Pakistan  Council  for Science  
and Technology  to advise  the Government  on national  policies  on science,  technology  and 
innovation  for building  up a strong and self-reliant  science  and technology  system  and its effective  
working  directed  towards  achievement  of national  goals  and in particular  the welfare  of the people,  
economic  growth  and security  of Pakistan;  
 
It is hereby  enacted  as follows:  
 
1. Short t itle, extent and commencement. ― (1) This Act may be called  the Pakistan  
Council  for Science  and Technology  Act, 2017.  
 
(2) It extends  to the whole  of Pakistan.   
(3) It shall  come  into force  at once.  
2.  Definitions. — In this Act, unless  there  is anything  repugnant  in the subject  or context,  
 
(a)  “Board ” means  the Board  of Governors  of the Council;   
(b)  “Chairperson ” means  head  of the Council;  
(c)  “Council ” means  Pakistan  Council  for Science  and Technology;  
(d)  “Executive  Committee ” means  Executive  Commi ttee of the Board  constituted  
under  section  11; 
(e)  “expert  committee ” means  an expert  committee  of the Council  constituted  
under  section  14; 
(f)  “member ” means  a member  of the Board;  
(g)  “prescribed ” means  prescribed  by regulations  made  under  this Act;  
(h)  “President ” means  President  of the Board;  
(i) “regulations ” means  regulations  made  under  this Act; 
(j)  “Resolution ” means  the Resolution  notified  vide Notification  No. 3(5)/  
82-NSC,  dated  the I6th June,  1987  for constitution  of the devised  council  
dissolved  under  section  22; and 
(k)  “Vice -President ” means  Vice -President  of the Board.

 3. Establishment of the Council .― (1) On commencement  of this Act, there  shall  stand  
established  a Council  to be called  as Pakistan  Council  for Science  and Technology  in accordance  
with the provisions  of the Act. 
 
(2) The Council  shall  be a body  corporate  having  perpetual  succession  and a common  seal, 
with power,  subject  to the provisions  of this Act, to acquire,  sell and hold property,  and shall  by the 
said name  sue and be sued through  Chairperson.  
 
(3) The headquarters  of the Council  shall  be at Islamabad  and the Council  may establish  
regional  or sub-offices  as required.  
4.  Functions of the Council .— The Council  shall ― 
(a)  advise  the Federal  Government  on all matters  relating  to the development  of 
science  and technology  in Pakistan;  
(b)  undertake  policy  research,  organize  study  groups  or task forces,  formulate  
policy  proposals;  monitoring  and evaluation  of science,  technology  and 
innovation  policy  for achieving  targets  for the overall  development  of science  
and technology  in the country;  
 
(c)  identify  priority  areas  for research  and development  keeping  in view  futuristic  
developments  of science  and technology;  
 
 
(d)  constitute  expert  committees  in various  disciplines  for preparation  of reports  
on policies  and issues  of national  importance  in respect  of science  and 
technology;  
(e)  collect,  update  statistics  and maintain  database  on science  and technology  
potentials  of the country;  
(f)  take measures  for effective  collaboration  among  academia,  research  and 
development  organizations  and industry  for development  of indigenous  
products  or technologies;  
(g)  evaluation  of national  research  and development  activities  includ ing output  of 
individuals  and institutions  and to grant  research  productivity  awards  or 
incentives  thereof;  · 
(h)  promote  collaboration  among  national  and international  organizations  for 
capacity -building  and other  policy  initiatives  in the field of scien ce and 
technology  and to enter  into memoranda  of understanding,  contracts  etc., in 
accordance  with the Rules  of Business,  1973;  
(i)  participate  in national  science  and technology  planning  and development  
activities  and providing  advice  on selection of pro jects;    
(j) act as Secretariat of the National Commission for Science and Technology 
(NCST); and

 (k) perform  any other  functions  as may be assigned  to it by the 
FederalGovernment.  
5. Management. —The management  of the Council  shall  comprise ― 
(a)  Board of Governors;  
(b) Executive Committee; and  
(c) Chairperson,  
6. Board of Governors. —The general control and superintendence of  the affairs of the 
Council shall vest in the Board.

(2) The Chairperson shall act as Secretary of the Board.  
(3) The Federal Government may, by notification in the official Gazette,  increase or decrease 
the number of members of the Board.  
(4) The Board ma y co-opt any other professional or expert . 
8. Functions and powers of the Board. —(1) The Board shall —  
 
(a) review and approve annual, long -term plans, policies and programmes  
of the Council;  
(b) approve the annual development and non -development budget o f the 
Council;  
(c) create or abolish posts of such officers and staff and engage such consultants 
or experts as it may consider necessary for efficient performance of the 
functions of the Council, on such terms and  conditions as may be prescribed;  
 
(d) make regulations for the efficient conduct of the affairs of the Council;  
and 
(e) recommend to the Government to terminate the tenure of the  Chairperson 
before its expiry in case of unsatisfactory performance.  
(2) The Board may, by general or special order in  writing, direct that such  of its powers shall, 
in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may  be specified in the order, be 
exercised, by the Executive Committee, Chairperson or  an officer of the Council.  
 
9. Term of office of members .—(1) Save as hereinafter provided, a member, other than an 
ex officio member, shall hold office for a period of three years from the date of his nomination and 
shall be eligible for re -nomination for a further period not exceeding another term.  
(2) A person who becomes, or is nominated to be, a member by virtue of his holding an office 
or appointment shall cease to be a member when he ceases to hold that office or appointment.  
(3) A member, other than an ex officio member, may at any time resign his membershi p by 
writing under his hand addressed to the Federal Government.  
(4) A vacancy caused by resignation or any other reason shall be filled by nomination of a 
person qualified to fill such vacancy.  
(5) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid merely  on the ground of existence of a 
vacancy in constitution of the Board.

 10. Meetings of the Board .—(1) Save as hereinafter provided, the Board  shall regulate the 
procedure for its meetings.  
(2) Meetings of the Board shall be called and presided by its Presi dent or  in his absence by 
the Vice -President on such date, time and place as deemed fit  provided that at least two meetings 
shall be held in a year.  
(3) At least ten members shall constitute the quorum for a meeting of the  Board.  
11. Executive Committee of  the Board. —(1)Notwithstanding anything contained in this 
Act, the Executive Committee shall take decisions on behalf of the Board subject to ratification by 
the Board at its meeting immediately following the meeting of the Executive Committee unless 
other wise authorized by the Board.  
(2) The Executive Committee shall comprise the following members,  namely: — 
 
(a) Chairperson of the Council  Chairperson  
(b) one member to be nominated by 
the Board  
 Member  
(c) dealing officer not below the 
rank of Joint  Secre tary of the 
Division  controlling subject  
matter of science and 
technology  
 Member  
(d) Secretary of the Council  Member  
(3) The Secretary of the Council shall act as the Secretary of the Executive  Committee.  
(4) Subject to the provisions of this Act and re gulations made in this behalf  and such general 
or special directions as may, from time to time, be given by the  Board, the Executive Committee 
shall deal with any matter as authorized by the  Board.  
12. Chairperson of the Council .—The Chairperson shall be  an eminent scientist or engineer 
holding a Ph.D degree with sufficient relevant experience to be appointed by the Prime Minister on 
recommendations of the Federal Government for a term of three years extendable for another term 
on such terms and condition s as may be prescribed.  
 
13. Powers and functions of the Chairperson. —The Chairperson , who shall be the Chief 
Executive Officer of the Council, shall work under the general policy guidelines of the Board and 
have such powers, functions and duties as may be conferred or vested in him by or under this Act, 
including — 
(a) formulation of research policies, plans and their submission to the Board  for 
approval;  
(b) protection of all assets of the Council including intellectual property  assets;  
 
Page 8 of 10 
 (c) preparation o f annual report of the Council for subm ission to the Federal    
Government;    
(d) for the purpose of ensuring efficient functioning of the Council and to  facilitate its 
day-to-day functions, delegation to the Secretary or other  officers of the Council, 
such of his powers or duties as he may consider  necessary from time to time; and  
(e)  appointment of such officers and employees subject to the provisions  of relevant 
regulations, as may be necessary for efficient performance  of functions of the 
Council on suc h terms and conditions as may be  prescribed.  
14. Expert committees .—(1) The Council may constitute expert  committees, in important 
scientific, technological and engineering disciplines to review  current status and suggest policy 
measures for their future development.  
(2) The expert committees shall have such powers and perform such  functions as may be 
assigned by the Council.  
15.  Fund of the Council —There shall be a Fund of the Council to be  called the PCST Fund 
to which shall be credited — 
(a) funds of th e devised council being dissolved under section 22, which shall 
stand transferred to the Council;  
(b) grants from the Governments ; 
(c) donations and endowments;  
(d) funds generated through its own resources; and  
(e) research grants.  
16. Budget and accounts .—(1) The Chairperson shall, in respect of  each financial year, 
submit for the approval of the Board, a statement showing all  the expenditures incurred during the 
year alongwith estimated receipts and  expenditures for the next financial year.  
(2) The Counc il shall, by such date and in such form as may be prescribed, submit to the 
Federal Government for approval of its budget for each financial year showing the estimated receipts 
and expenditures and the sums which are likely to be required from the Federal Government during 
the financial year.  
(3) The accounts of the Council shall be maintained in such form and manner as determined 
by the Federal Government.  
(4) The accounts of the Council shall be audited by the Auditor -General of Pakistan.  
17.  Appointment  of officers, staff, etc .—(1) The Council may, from time to time, appoint 
such officers and staff as it may consider necessary for the efficient performance of its functions, on 
such terms and conditions as may be prescribed.  
(2) The Council may engage exp erts or consultants on such terms and conditions as may be 
prescribed.

18. Submission of reports. etc .—The Council shall submit to the Federal Government at 
such time and at such intervals, as the Federal Government may specify, — 
(a) annual report on work ing of the Council;  
(b) such periodical reports and summaries as may be required by the  Federal 
Government;  
(c) such periodical returns, accounts, statements and statistics as may be  required 
by the Federal Government;  
(d) information and comments asked fo r by the Federal Government on any 
speci fic point;  
(e) copies of the documents required by the Federal Government; and  
(f) original documents required by the Federal Government for examination  
or any other purpose.  
 
19. Directives from the Federal Governme nt.—The Federal Government  may, from time 
to time, issue to the Council such directives and orders in writing, as it may consider necessary for 
carrying out the purpose of this Act and the Council shall be bound to follow and carry out such 
directives and orders.  
20. Declaration of fidelity and secrecy. —Every member, expert, officer or other employee 
of the Council shall make such declaration of fidelity and secrecy as may be prescribed.  
21. Continuance of certain rules, etc. —All rules, regulations and byel aws related to the 
Council and in force immediately before the commencement of this Act shall, mutatis mutandis and 
so far as they are not inconsistent with any of the provisions of this Act, apply and continue in force 
until repealed or amended or  altered . 
22. Repeal and Savings. —(1) The Ministry of Science and Technology's Resolution notified 
vide No. 3(5)/82 -NSC, dated the 16th June, 1987 is hereby repealed and the Pakistan Council of 
Science and Technology, hereinafter referred to as the devised council , reconstituted there under 
shall stand dissolved.  
(2) Upon dissolution of the devised council under sub -section (1), — 
(a)  all assets, rights, powers, authorities, privileges and property, movable  and 
immovable, cash and bank balance, reserve funds, inves tments  and all other 
interests and rights in, liabilities and obligations of whatever  kind of t he 
devised council subsisting immediately before its dissolution  shall stand 
transferred to and vest in the Council;  
(b)  all officers and other employees of the  devised council shall, notwithstanding 
anything contained in any law, agreement, deed, document or other 
instrument, stand transferred to the Council on the  exercise of one -time 
irrevocable option to either remain a civil servant under the Civil Servants 
Act, 1973 (LXX1 of 1973) and shall be entitled to all the privileges and 
 
Page 10 of 10 
 facilities of the Federal Government such as  pension, gratuity, housing, health, 
etc. or to become an employee of ,the Council, in accordance with their 
existing terms and condition o f the service applicable to them and no officer 
or other employee whose  services are so transferred shall be entitled to any 
compensation because of such transfer;  
(c) all debts and obligations incurred or contracts entered into or rights acquired 
and all matters and things engaged to be done by, with or for the devised 
council before its dissolution shall be deemed to have been  incurred, entered 
into, acquired or engaged to be done by, with or for the Council;  
(d)  all suits and other legal proceedings ins tituted by or against the devised 
council, before its dissolution, shall be deemed to be suits and proceedings by 
or against the Council and may be proceeded or otherwise dealt with 
accordingly; and  
(e) all actions done by the devised council before the commencement of  
this Act shall be deemed to be done under this Act.  
23. Exemption from taxes .—Notwithstanding anything contained in the Income Tax 
Ordinance, 2001 (XLIX of 2001) or any other law for the time being in force relating to income tax, 
the C ouncil shall not be liable to pay any such tax on its income, capital, profit, wealth, gifts or gains 
and any movable and immovable property.  
 
24. Power to make regulations. —The Board may, by notification in the official Gazette, 
make regulations, not inco nsistent with the provisions of this Act, for carrying out the purposes of 
this Act.  
 
25. Removal of difficulties. —If any difficulty arises in giving effect to  any provision of this 
Act, the Federal Government may make such order, not  inconsistent with the  provisions of this Act, 
as may appear to it to be necessary or  expedient for the purpose of removal of such difficulty:  
 
Provided that such power shall not be exercised after expiry of two years  from the 
commencement of this Act.
